title: Why Now? The Lost Chances to Reach a Hostage Deal, and a Cease-Fire, Months Ago
summary: On Gaza, President Trump put few, if any, guardrails on Israel’s offensive, bucking international demands for a cease-fire. Then he changed course.

title: Israel and Hamas Were Not Ready for a Comprehensive Peace Deal, Mediator Says
summary: The Qatari prime minister told The New York Times that Gaza war mediators decided to delay talks on more difficult issues so a hostage-prisoner swap could be concluded quickly.

title: Trump Heads to Israel and Then Egypt as Hostage-Prisoner Swap Nears
summary: In Israel, he plans to meet with hostage families and address the Knesset, and in Egypt, he will help lead a summit with more than 20 countries to discuss the peace process in Gaza.

title: What We Know About the Deal Between Israel and Hamas
summary: Hostages in Gaza are set to be swapped for Palestinian prisoners in Israel. The releases are expected to begin early on Monday morning.

title: How Trump’s Chicago Immigration Crackdown Escalated, in 10 Videos
summary: Week by week, the federal campaign to ramp up immigration enforcement in the Chicago area has created fear and inflamed tensions.

title: These Students Are Scared. Friends and Teachers Are Their Protectors.
summary: Sometimes, they offer a place to stay to immigrant children. Other times, they provide help navigating the legal system. They have become part of the resistance.

title: Trump Has Not Ruled Out Invoking Insurrection Act to Deploy National Guard, Vance Says
summary: Vice President JD Vance asserted in an interview on NBC News’ “Meet the Press” that crime was “out of control” in major U.S. cities.

title: Cars to Fighter Jets: China’s New Export Curbs May Level a Heavy Blow Worldwide
summary: Broad restrictions could cause supply interruptions for arms makers, as well as manufacturers in the semiconductor, automotive and other sectors.

title: How Las Vegas Sands Helped Get the N.B.A. Back Into China
summary: Las Vegas Sands, owned by the Adelson family, was under pressure in Macau, with billions at stake. That created an opportunity.

title: N.B.A. Head Criticizes Chinese Party Paper Over LeBron James ‘Op-Ed’
summary: The People’s Daily newspaper put the star player’s name on an opinion article, an example of the political perils the N.B.A. could face in China.

title: The Destructive Legacy of California’s Zombie Fires
summary: Blazes that firefighters thought had died but then later came roaring back to life have become increasingly common, heightening scrutiny of how first-responders put out wildfires.

title: California Orders Insurers to Pay More for Wildfire Victims’ Lost Items
summary: After years of fires that left families tallying every burned toothbrush, a new law is requiring insurers to ease a grueling burden.

title: The Surprising Power of Diane Keaton’s Emotional Transparency
summary: Earlier roles in “The Godfather” and later roles in “Something’s Gotta Give” showed the depth and nuance of the actress whom we met in “Annie Hall.”

title: Diane Keaton in ‘Reds’: A Remarkable Performance but Also a Returning Point
summary: Her character, an early-20th-century journalist, undergoes the most dramatic transformation of the film in ways that the actress was especially suited for.

title: Diane Keaton Was the Definition of a Style Icon
summary: Her legacy will include the ways she shaped fashion, rather than allowing fashion to shape her.

title: Orban’s ‘Propaganda State’ in Hungary Is Starting to Show Cracks
summary: The Hungarian leader has secured power by keeping control over the news media. Now, a political opponent is starting to show the limits of his tactics.

title: Inside the Closed-Door Meetings of the N.F.L.’s Billionaire Owners
summary: Every three months, closed-door meetings of the billionaires who own N.F.L. teams become displays of status, beefs and sometimes Trump-induced headaches.

title: What’s the Deal With All Those FanDuel Ads?
summary: Peter Jackson, the chief executive of Flutter Entertainment, FanDuel’s parent company, is fighting for attention as online gambling spreads across the United States.

title: Nor’easter Brings Heavy Rain and Flooding as It Moves Up East Coast
summary: The Mid-Atlantic and Northeast will bear the brunt of the storm, which will usher in beach erosion and flooding, Monday into Tuesday, forecasters said.

title: How ‘TBPN’ Became Silicon Valley’s Newest Obsession
summary: Silicon Valley is obsessed with “TBPN,” a streaming show on which no career move is too trivial to document.

title: How the Young Lords Took Over Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx — Twice
summary: In 1970, the Young Lords, a Puerto Rican civil rights group, seized a hospital in the Bronx — twice.

title: How a Trump Judge Exposed the Trump Con
summary: Dishonest presidents should be entitled to no deference at all.

title: What Ted Lasso, the Bhargava Gita and Derrida Can Teach Us About Ourselves
summary: Our culture is amok with binaries. We have two major parties, just two, and they are forever opposed.

title: South Carolina Bar Shooting Leaves at Least 4 Dead, Sheriff Says
summary: Four people were in critical condition after an early-morning shooting that left 12 other people injured on Sunday in St. Helena, S.C., according to the Beaufort County Sheriff’s Office.

title: John Searle, Philosopher Who Wrestled With A.I., Dies at 93
summary: His blunt debating and imaginative theorizing about artificial intelligence and the human mind made him a leading scholar. But sexual-harassment allegations ended his career.

title: 2 Dead After Small Plane Crashes Into Semitrailers Near Texas Airfield
summary: It was unknown what led up to the crash on Sunday afternoon near Hicks Airfield outside of Fort Worth.
